designScenario.name: S A T C O M Module
designScenario.description: The S A T C O M Module is an advanced avionics system enabling global, secure, and low-latency satellite communication for passenger aircraft. It supports real-time telemetry, flight path optimization, crew/passenger connectivity, and emergency coordination. The module employs adaptive frequency agility, multi-layer encryption, and fault-tolerant architecture to meet DO-178C/DAL-B safety standards and ARINC 791 interoperability requirements.

details.description: Establish simultaneous links with L-band (1-2 GHz) and Ka-band (26.5-40 GHz) satellites for global coverage and high-throughput data transfer.
Automatically switch between satellite constellations (e.g., Iridium, Inmarsat, ViaSat) based on signal strength and network availability.
Achieve asymmetric data rates up to 50 Mbps downlink / 10 Mbps uplink in Ka-band mode for passenger connectivity services.
Maintain end-to-end latency below 300ms for ATC datalink communications (CPDLC) during critical flight phases.
Implement triple-redundant modem units with majority voting logic to prevent single-point communication failures.
Integrate radiation-hardened components capable of withstanding single-event upsets (SEUs) at maximum cruise altitudes.
Utilize quantum-resistant encryption (CRYSTALS-Kyber) with FIPS 140-3 compliant key management for classified data channels.
Support over-the-air (OTA) software updates with dual-bank flash memory to enable in-service upgrades without downtime.

systemComponents.name: S A T C O M Module
systemComponents.description: Primary communication hub integrating satellite transceivers, beamforming antennas, and network security components for airborne connectivity

subComponents.name: Phased-Array Antenna System
subComponents.description: Electronically steerable antenna array with 256 elements providing ±75° azimuth/elevation coverage and adaptive beamforming

subComponents.name: Multi-Band Transceiver Stack
subComponents.description: Software-defined radio supporting simultaneous L-band (Aero-L) and Ka-band (SwiftBroadband-Safety) waveforms with 4x4 MIMO capability

subComponents.name: Quantum Encryption Unit
subComponents.description: Post-quantum cryptography module implementing lattice-based algorithms for key exchange and AES-GCM-256 data encryption

subComponents.name: Network Processor Unit
subComponents.description: Dual-core ARM Cortex-A76 processor managing QoS for multiple virtual channels (ATN, ACARS, APD, passenger Wi-Fi)

subComponents.name: Power Conditioning Module
subComponents.description: 28VDC-to-48VDC converter with surge protection and 90% efficiency under MIL-STD-704F power quality standards

relationships.source: S A T C O M Module
relationships.description: The antenna system is an integral part of the SATCOM Module, physically enclosed within the LRU and managed via dedicated beam steering controllers
All transceiver I/O channels are routed through the encryption unit for mandatory data-in-transit protection
The processor depends on the aircraft's central network for time synchronization via ARINC 664 P7 datalinks
Draws power from both main and emergency electrical buses with automatic load shedding capabilities
